frame.name: Non-commutative_process
frame.definition:
<def-root>LUs in this frame describe a non-commutative process (as opposed to a generic statement) of arithmetic, e.g. subtraction and division, involving two numbers, labeled <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen>. Because of the non-commutative nature of these processes, <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen> are not separated on a grammatical basis but rather on a mathematical basis (see FE definitions). When referencing the process, the numbers can be vague and are often omitted through indefinite null instantiation.
<ex><fex name="Calculator">I</fex> <t>divided</t> <fex name="Term_1">x</fex> <fex name="Term_2">by y</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Term_1
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Term_1</fen> is the first operand in the non-commutative arithmetic that is modified by <fen>Term_2</fen> (e.g. subtracted by or divided by <fen>Term_2</fen>).</def-root>

FE.name: Term_2
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Term_2</fen> is the second operand of the non-commutative arithmetic which modifies <fen>Term_1</fen> (e.g. subtracts from or divides <fen>Term_1</fen>).</def-root>

FE.name: Calculator
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Calculator</fen> is the agentive entity that combines <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: subtract.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take away (a number or amount) from another to calculate the difference

lexUnit.name: divide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: find how many times (a number) contains another

lexUnit.name: subtraction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of finding the difference between two numbers

lexUnit.name: division.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the process of dividing a matrix, vector, or another quantity by another under specific rules to obtain a quotient
